member.name: T:Xamarin.InAppBilling.SimpleJson
member.summary: This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/ JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.name: T:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult
member.summary: Avalible response codes returned by methods from the InAppBillingService functions that are part of Google Play In-App Billing.
member.remarks: BillingResult was represented as a sealed class with computed properties instead of an enum to better work with the Google Play InAppBillingService interface and Json.net.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.OK
member.summary: The transaction completed successfully.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.UserCancelled
member.summary: The user canceled the transaction.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Network connection is down.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.BillingUnavailable
member.summary: In-App Billing is not supported on the given Android device.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.ItemUnavailable
member.summary: The requested item is unavailable for purchase.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.DeveloperError
member.summary: An invalid argument has been passed to the API or the app was not correctly signed, properly set up for In-app Billing in Google Play Dashboard, or does not have the necessary permissions in its manifest.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.Error
member.summary: A fatal error occurred during an API action.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.ItemAlreadyOwned
member.summary: The user already owns the given item.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.BillingResult.ItemNotOwned
member.summary: The given item has not been purchased by the user.

member.name: T:Xamarin.InAppBilling.ReservedTestProductIDs
member.summary: Contains the reserved product IDs use to test In-App Billing via Google Play without actually making a purchase. To test your implementation with static responses, you make an In-app Billing request using a special item that has a reserved product ID. Each reserved product ID returns a specific static response from Google Play. No money is transferred when you make In-app Billing requests with the reserved product IDs. Also, you cannot specify the form of payment when you make a billing request with a reserved product ID.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.ReservedTestProductIDs.Purchased
member.summary: When you make an In-app Billing request with this product ID, Google Play responds as though you successfully purchased an item.
member.remarks: The response includes a JSON string, which contains fake purchase information (for example, a fake order ID). In some cases, the JSON string is signed and the response includes the signature so you can test your signature verification implementation using these responses.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.ReservedTestProductIDs.Canceled
member.summary: When you make an In-app Billing request with this product ID Google Play responds as though the purchase was canceled.
member.remarks: This can occur when an error is encountered in the order process, such as an invalid credit card, or when you cancel a user's order before it is charged.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.ReservedTestProductIDs.Refunded
member.summary: When you make an In-app Billing request with this product ID, Google Play responds as though the purchase was refunded.
member.remarks: Refunds cannot be initiated through Google Play's in-app billing service. Refunds must be initiated by you (the merchant). After you process a refund request through your Google Wallet merchant account, a refund message is sent to your application by Google Play. This occurs only when Google Play gets notification from Google Wallet that a refund has been made.

member.name: F:Xamarin.InAppBilling.ReservedTestProductIDs.Unavailable
member.summary: When you make an In-app Billing request with this product ID, Google Play responds as though the item being purchased was not listed in your application's product list.

member.name: T:System.Security.Cryptography.Crypto
member.summary: The provides an easy way encrypt and decrypt data using a simple password.
member.remarks: Code based on the book "C# 3.0 in a nutshell by Joseph Albahari" (pages 630-632) and from this StackOverflow post by somebody called Brett http://stackoverflow.com/questions/202011/encrypt-decrypt-string-in-net/2791259#2791259

member.summary: Takes the given text string and encrypts it using the given password.

member.summary: Takes the given encrypted text string and decrypts it using the given password

member.summary: Performs an in-memory encrypt/decrypt transformation on a byte array.
member.returns: The memory crypt.

member.name: M:System.Security.Cryptography.Crypto.GetAlgorithm(System.String)
member.summary: Defines a RijndaelManaged algorithm and sets its key and Initialization Vector (IV) values based on the encryptionPassword received.
member.returns: The algorithm.

member.name: T:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security
member.summary: Utility class to support secure transactions for Google Play In-App Billing

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security.Unify(System.String[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: Recombines the given elements and segments to reconstruct an obfuscated string.
member.param: List of elements used to reconstruct the string.
List of segments speciying the order of the elements.
member.remarks: Given a list of elements {"A","B","C","D"} and segments {1,0,3,2} this function returns "BADC". This function is used to hide a string inside of a Xamarin.Android app.

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security.Unify(System.String[],System.Int32[],System.String[])
member.summary: Recombines the given elements, segments and hashes to reconstruct an obfuscated string.
member.param: List of elements used to reconstruct the string.
List of segments speciying the order of the elements.
Given a list of elements {"A","B","C123","D"}, segments {1,0,3,2} and hashes {"123","007"} this function returns "BADC007". This function is used to hide a string inside of a Xamarin.Android app.

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security.VerifyPurchase(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies the purchase.
member.returns: true, if purchase was verified, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security.GeneratePublicKey(System.String)
member.summary: Generates the public key.
member.returns: The public key.

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.Utilities.Security.Verify(Java.Security.IPublicKey,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Verify the specified publicKey, signedData and signature.

member.name: T:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection
member.summary: The class binds your Activity to the Google Play’s In-app Billing service to send In-app Billing requests to Google Play from your application. As part of the setup process, the also checks if the In-app Billing Version 3 API is supported by Google Play. If the API version is not supported, or if an error occured while establishing the service binding, the listener is notified and passed an error message.

member.name: P:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection.Service
member.summary: Gets the Google Play InAppBillingService interface.

member.name: P:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection.BillingHandler
member.summary: Gets the used to communicate with the Google Play Service

member.name: P:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection.PublicKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the Google Play Service public key used for In-App Billing
member.remarks: NOTE: The key will be encrypted when it is stored in memory.

member.name: P:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection.Connected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is connected to the Google Play service

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Connect this instance to the Google Play service to support In-App Billing in your application

member.name: M:Xamarin.InAppBilling.InAppBillingServiceConnection.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects this instance from the Google Play service.
member.remarks: Important: Remember to unbind from the In-app Billing service when you are done with your activity. If you don’t unbind, the open service connection could cause your device’s performance to degrade. To unbind and free your system resources, call the Disconnect method when your Activity gets destroyed.
